title: Measures and Masks
description: The Hall of Shares becomes a theater. Matron Selde, Sera Verrin, Guildmother Brynna, Olan Vetch, and Prior Ansel gather under a crown of wind-bells that ring like a ledger of accusations. The counterfeit scandal is cooling, the moths sing again, and the Order’s vigil lantern burns—but the reed-thing feeds faster, and the river drops. Sera advances a charter to make House Verrin the city’s outfitter for all upriver expeditions—promising discipline and efficiency. Arelon asks Kezra to arbitrate a compact instead: Pilots, Spindlewrights, and the Order bound together by a public oath-chart in the Lantern Archive. The Night Cartographers tug at an old thread—a route Kezra sold in a desperate year—dangling shame as a price for silence. The room tastes of salt and sugar: Verrin customs laid bare.
objectives: Convene the stakeholders and present the case for a public oath-chart held at the Lantern Archive.
Expose the counterfeit line’s method without humiliating the Exchange; propose safeguards that strengthen trust.
Confront the Night Cartographers’ leverage publicly before it festers; admit fault and close the thread.
Draft and secure signatures on the tri-fold compact between Pilots, Spindlewrights, and the Order; deny or amend Sera’s charter without making an enemy beyond repair.

dialogue.speaker: Arelon Vale
dialogue.lines: We can braid our strengths or we can each drown in a corner and pretend we were the last to breathe. I prefer braiding. Kezra, set the pace. Speak for a lantern that shines on all hands equally, even if it shows my calluses along with everyone else’s.

dialogue.speaker: Sera Verrin
dialogue.lines: Order is not a sin, and neither is ambition. My charter would feed your city a diet of predictability. That’s not tyranny; that’s mercy without a procession. But I will not sign a compact that binds my house to rites that turn on a priest’s mouth and a pilot’s whistle.

dialogue.speaker: Brynna Coil
dialogue.lines: Trade is a loom, and this room is a tangle. I will sign your compact if you guarantee that no child spends winter without wool because a Factor wanted to prove a point with scrip. Put that in your lantern, Kezra, and let it burn hot.

dialogue.speaker: Olan Vetch
dialogue.lines: I’ll take vows on paper if they keep ropes out of my men’s necks and keep cowards from buying pilots by the finger. But if I see one clause slipped in with a sugar sprinkle of Verrin courtesy, I’ll whistle the Brotherhood out of the river and let the Hall count casks on dry land.

dialogue.speaker: Kezra Thorneglass
dialogue.lines: I sold a small route once to pay a healer, and I’ve hated the shape of that coin every day since. I’ll not let a map of my shame steer the City now. We draft the oath-chart here, we hang it in the Lantern Archive where anyone can read it, and we bind it to a bell that rings when someone tries to trim it. Sera, bring your efficiency; just don’t ask it to sit on the scales with its thumb out.

locations: Salt Crown Exchange hall (Hall of Shares)
npcs_involved: Prior Ansel of the Black Thistle

rewards: Signed Compact of River and Loom (formal backing for final rite)
Access writ to Lantern Archive’s oath-chamber at all hours
House Verrin grudging courtesy pass (reduced interference from Verrin bravos)
